hints.content:
A rectangle with $\blueE3$ same-size rows looks like this:

![A square divided into 3 equal rows. The rows are numbered 1, 2, and 3.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/13241ec193a146463878a862577d04e7f75e986c)

A rectangle with $\maroonD3$ same-size columns looks like this:

![A square divided into 3 equal columns. The columns are numbered 1, 2, and 3.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/8c4a46082c6b070ebe7599484e34a4383a372289)
Which rectangle shows $\blueE3$ rows and $\maroonD3$ columns of same-size squares?

This rectangle shows $\blueE3$ rows and $\maroonD3$  columns of same-size squares:

![A rectangle divided into 9 equal squares in 3 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e613fd7bdd4124f61ec2d50462b7cb9891425420)

question.content:
**Which rectangle is split into $3$ rows with $3$ columns of same-size squares?**

[[â˜ƒ radio 1]]

choices.content: ![A rectangle divided into 9 equal squares in 3 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/e613fd7bdd4124f61ec2d50462b7cb9891425420)
![A rectangle divided into 12 equal squares in 4 columns.](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/b079caabb89c8fb0bb51a9d33899a2d40399bbb6)
